Primary SHAP analysis indicates: cumulative seasonal depletion memory is driving depletion upward; long-term structural decline trend is moderating depletion; seasonal groundwater volatility is driving depletion upward. Recommended transition to Rice could reduce water consumption by 0% per kilogram of output.

Recommendation_Text: Maintain current crop mix — water saving from any transition is below 10% and does not justify agricultural disruption at this time.
Flood_Actions: Proceed with standard Samba sowing calendar. Monitor NE monsoon progress weekly from October 1.
Drought_Actions: Proceed with standard Kuruvai calendar. Monitor SW monsoon progress bi-weekly from May 1. Fallback option if deficit develops: Bajra.

Recommendation_Text: Transition to Jowar and Bajra — 11% blended water saving. Target mix: Rice 56%→45%, Jowar 23%→28%, Bajra 0%→4%. Prioritise in Samba season. Coordinate with block agricultural officer.
Flood_Actions: Proceed with standard Samba sowing calendar. Monitor NE monsoon progress weekly from October 1.
Drought_Actions: SW monsoon 2% below normal with GW at 8.4m and 75% groundwater dependency. Mandatory switch to Jowar for Kuruvai season (short-duration variety). Restrict pump operation to 6 hours per day from June 1. Activate district drought relief fund and MNREGS water conservation works. Prioritise drinking water supply over irrigation from May 15.
